00021 /*===========================================================================
00022  * DEFINES
00023  *=========================================================================*/
00024 
00025 #ifndef cbBNEP_MAX_LINKS
00026 #define cbBNEP_MAX_LINKS (7)
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 // Max Ethernet frame size
00030 // header (14) + payload (1500) + 802.1Q Tag header (4) => 1518
00031 #define cbBNEP_MAX_FRAME_SIZE               ((cb_uint32)1518)
00032 
00033 #define cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS               ((cb_int32)0x00000000)
00034 #define cbBNEP_RESULT_ERROR                 ((cb_int32)0x00000001)
00035 #define cbBNEP_RESULT_ILLEGAL_HANDLE        ((cb_int32)0x00000002)
00036 #define cbBNEP_RESULT_FLOW_STOP             ((cb_int32)0x00000003)
00037 #define cbBNEP_RESULT_LINK_LOSS             ((cb_int32)0x00000004)
00038 
00039 #define cbBNEP_ILLEGAL_CONN_HANDLE          (INVALID_CONN_HANDLE)
00040 #define cbBNEP_ILLEGAL_BNEP_HANDLE          ((cb_uint32)0xFFFFFFFF)
00041 
00042 /*===========================================================================
00043  * TYPES
00044  *=========================================================================*/
00045 typedef cb_uint32   cbBNEP_Handle;
00046 
00047 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 * Callback to indicate the the BNEP channel is disconnected.
00049 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00050 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00051 typedef void (*cbBNEP_DisconnectEvt)       (cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle);
00052 
00053 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054 * Callback to indicate that the remote device wants to set up an BNEP
00055 * channel
00056 * - connHandle: Connection handle
00057 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00058 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00059 typedef void (*cbBNEP_ConnectInd)          (TConnHandle connHandle, cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle);
00060 
00061 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062 * Callback to indicate a new BNEP channel is connected.
00063 * - connHandle: Connection handle
00064 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00065 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00066 typedef void (*cbBNEP_ConnectEvt)          (TConnHandle connHandle, cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle);
00067 
00068 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 * Callback to indicate a new BNEP channel is connected.
00070 * - connHandle: Connection handle
00071 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00072 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 typedef void (*cbBNEP_ConnectCnf)          (TConnHandle connHandle, cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle);
00074 
00075 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076 * Callback to indicate that the BNEP channel could not be set up.
00077 * - connHandle: Connection handle
00078 * - errorCode: Error code, e.g. cbBNEP_RESULT_ERROR
00079 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00080 typedef void (*cbBNEP_ConnectCnfNeg)       (TConnHandle connHandle, cb_int32 errorCode);
00081 
00082 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00083 * Callback to indicate that data has been received from remote device.
00084 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00085 * - length: Length of the data
00086 * - pData: Pointer to the data
00087 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00088 typedef void (*cbBNEP_DataEvt)             (cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle, cb_uint16 length, cb_uint8* pData);
00089 
00090 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091 * Callback to indicate that data has been taken care by BNEP. New
00092 * data can now be sent on this BNEP channel.
00093 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00094 * - result: cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS if the data sending succeeded
00095 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00096 typedef void (*cbBNEP_DataCnf)             (cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle, cb_int32 result);
00097 
00098 /* BNEP Channel Administration */
00099 typedef struct
00100 {
00101   cbBNEP_DisconnectEvt      disconnectEvt;
00102   cbBNEP_ConnectInd         connectInd;
00103   cbBNEP_ConnectEvt         connectEvt;
00104   cbBNEP_ConnectCnf         connectCnf;
00105   cbBNEP_ConnectCnfNeg      connectCnfNeg;
00106   cbBNEP_DataEvt            dataEvt;
00107   cbBNEP_DataCnf            dataCnf;
00108 
00109 } cbBNEP_Callback;
00110 
00111 /* BNEP Role */
00112 typedef enum
00113 {
00114     cbBNEP_R_PANU = 8,
00115     cbBNEP_R_NAP = 9,
00116     cbBNEP_R_NONE = 255
00117 
00118 } cbBNEP_Role;

00121 * FUNCTIONS

00123 
00124 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00125 * Find out if BNEP resource is free for the specified handle.
00126 * Returns TRUE if resource is available.
00127 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00128 cb_boolean cbBNEPIsHandleFree(cbBNEP_Handle handle);
00129 
00130 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00131 * Sets maximum allowed bnep connections
00132 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00133 void cbBNEPSetMaxLinks(cb_int32 maxLinks);
00134 
00135 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00136 * Initializes the Bluetooth BNEP module.
00137 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS on success.
00138 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 extern void      cbBNEP_init            (void);
00140 
00141 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142 * Registers callback functions.
00143 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS.
00144 * - localBdAddr: Bluetooth address of local device.
00145 * - pCallback: Pointer to structure of callbacks to register.
00146 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00147 extern cb_int32  cbBNEP_register        (TBdAddr localBdAddr, cbBNEP_Callback *pCallback);
00148 
00149 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00150 * Registers the server role the local device.
00151 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS.
00152 * - serverRole: PAN role of the local server.
00153 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00154 extern cb_int32  cbBNEP_registerServer  (cbBNEP_Role serverRole);
00155 
00156 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00157 * Creates a new BNEP connection on an existing ACL connection.
00158 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS on success.
00159 * - connHandle: ACL connection handle
00160 * - localDeviceRole: PAN role of the local device.
00161 * - remoteDeviceRole: PAN role of the remote device.
00162 * - remoteBdAddr: The Bluetooth address of the remote device.
00163 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00164 extern cb_int32 cbBNEP_reqConnect(
00165     TConnHandle     connHandle,
00166     cbBNEP_Role     localDeviceRole,
00167     cbBNEP_Role     remoteDeviceRole,
00168     TBdAddr         remoteBdAddr);
00169 
00170 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00171 * Disconnects the BNEP channel.
00172 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS.
00173 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00174 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00175 extern cb_int32 cbBNEP_cmdDisconnect(cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle);
00176 
00177 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00178 * Accepts a BNEP connection by responding on a cbBNEP_ConnectInd callback.
00179 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS on success.
00180 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00181 * - bdAddrRemoteDevice: Bluetooth address of the remote device of the ACL link.
00182 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00183 extern cb_int32 cbBNEP_rspConnect   (cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle, TBdAddr bdAddrRemoteDevice);
00184 
00185 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00186 * Rejects a BNEP connection.
00187 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS on success.
00188 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00189 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00190 extern cb_int32 cbBNEP_rspNegConnect(cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle);
00191 
00192 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00193 * Sends data to the remote device. Note that you have to wait for the
00194 * confirmation callback (cbBNEP_DataCnf) before calling another cbBNEP_reqData.
00195 * Returns cbBNEP_RESULT_SUCCESS on success.
00196 * - bnepHandle: BNEP handle
00197 * - pBuf: Pointer to the data
00198 * - bufSize: Length of the data
00199 *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00200 extern cb_int32 cbBNEP_reqData      (cbBNEP_Handle bnepHandle, cb_uint8* pBuf, cb_uint16 bufSize);
